metadata.title: CVE-2023-38522 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Apache Traffic Server accepts characters that are not allowed for HTTPfield names and forwards malformed requests to origin servers. This can beutilized for request smuggling and may also lead cache poisoning if theorigin servers are vulnerable.This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.10, from9.0.0 through 9.2.4.Users are recommended to upgrade to version 8.1.11 or 9.2.5, which fixesthe issue.

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
